In my opinion, translating "overhead" simply as "ì¶”ê°€ì ì¸ ì‹œê°„" is a somewhat limited interpretation. Generally, "overhead" doesn't refer solely to time but to the extra processing cost (e.g., time, memory, computation, etc.) incurred when performing a particular task or process.

Currently, there isn't an established translation for "overhead" in the Korean version of the documentation. Moreover, in [the German translation of the FastAPI benchmarks document](https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/de/benchmarks/)â€”which is one of the most frequently referenced sources for this termâ€”"overhead" is left unchanged. Considering these examples, it might be best for us to use "overhead" as is in our translation, to avoid any confusion and to convey the original meaning accurately.

Therefore, instead of translating "overhead" as "ì¶”ê°€ì ì¸ ì‹œê°„," it's preferable to leave it as "ì˜¤ë²„í—¤ë“œ."

discussion_comments.comment_body:
you don't translate the admonitions directly.

The right way to translate it is to keep the admonition, and then add a pipe + the translation.

You can check the docs for this at: [Translation specific tips and guidelines](https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/contributing/#translation-specific-tips-and-guidelines)

So, it would be:

/// tip | Dica
...
///
